0: Pepsi has a new ad out starring Kendall Jenner…and a hell of a lot of protesters. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It’s not entirely clear what the people marching in the streets are protesting––the signs mostly say generic things like “Peace,” “Love,” and “Join the Conversation.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR And towards the end, Jenner even hands a can of Pepsi to a cop. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR As you can imagine, this is going over extremely well on Twitter: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In fairness to Pepsi, their ad did bring people together. — Josh Barro (@jbarro) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR When you realize your entire 8 year goal of socially engineering America ends with a Kendall Jenner Pepsi commercial pic.twitter.com/6upt1ITPbb — Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR if only she’d given them a pepsi pic.twitter.com/rVM8jkJrG4 — darkwing duck fan (@vmochama) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pepsi just made the commercial of the year for Coke. — John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kendall Jenner gives a Pepsi to a cop and rids the world of -isms. Y’all can go somewhere with this tone-deaf, shallow and over-produced ad. pic.twitter.com/CEr4cAw3Ld — Taryn Finley (@_TARYNitUP) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Inside the Pepsi ad pitch meeting: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “… and then Kendall Jenner solves oppression by handing an attractive policeman a Pepsi…” https://t.co/paXWbtSKPu — Joy Reid (@JoyAnnReid) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR most important in that Pepsi ad: why would that guy bring a cello to a protest — Dana Schwartz (@DanaSchwartzzz) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR it’s time to die https://t.co/HPZyPgs3G4 — rainn trillson (@bijanstephen) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR the Boston Tea Party, but, like, Pepsi cans are throwing Coke cans into Boston Harbor? — Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR I have a dream that one day Pepsi will hire enough black & brown people to make better decisions. — Clint Smith (@ClintSmithIII) April 4, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Well, at least they got people to join the conversation. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR You can watch the ad above. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR UPDATE –– 4/5, 2:20 pm ET: Pepsi has taken down the ad and apologized.
